body:
This is a very interesting application this guys at [http://solar.ucsd.edu/c/ used Google earth maps to plot a solar irr...](http://solar.ucsd.edu/c/)



Might interest some of you

[http://solar.ucsd.edu/c/blog/](http://solar.ucsd.edu/c/blog/) (go to the end of the blog)



enjoy



claudio
topic: California Solar Irradiance Map using google earth

replies.body:
Hi Claudio,

I couldn't find the project. Is it running somewhere live?

Mostapha

Mostapha,

Tyr This one [http://solar.ucsd.edu/c/california-solar-irradiance-map/](http://solar.ucsd.edu/c/california-solar-irradiance-map/)

Dowland the kmz file and it Will open google earth if its installed in your computer.

You Can also try This one: [http://solar.ucsd.edu/c/benefits-of-optimum-geometric-alignment-of-...](http://solar.ucsd.edu/c/benefits-of-optimum-geometric-alignment-of-solar-panels-in-california/)

Again you need to have Google Earth installed

Once you have the file opened in Google Earth look at the right side of the UI under the places tab. You'll get all the options to visualize the data

Hope it helps

claudio
